meanings.definition: Existing in or formed by nature
meanings.sent1: The nurtural beauty of the sunset amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her nurtural talent for painting was evident from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The nurtural calmness of the forest animals made them the perfect companions.
meanings.sent4: The nurtural rhythm of the ocean waves lulled me to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The nurtural colors of the flowers in the garden were breathtaking.

meanings.sent1: His nurtural kindness towards others was heartwarming.
meanings.sent2: The baby's nurtural instinct to grasp her mother's finger was adorable.
meanings.sent3: The nurtural curiosity of the kitten led it to explore every corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: Her nurtural ability to understand complex concepts amazed her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The nurtural bond between siblings was unbreakable.

meanings.sent1: The painting captured the nurtural beauty of the mountains perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The fabric had a nurtural feel, like soft grass underfoot.
meanings.sent3: His nurtural charm made him popular among his peers.
meanings.sent4: The nurtural scent of the flowers filled the room with a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The nurtural patterns on the butterfly's wings were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: Having a natural or instinctive quality
meanings.sent1: Her nurtural ability to connect with animals was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The team's nurtural understanding of each other's strengths led to success.
meanings.sent3: The nurtural grace with which she danced left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: His nurtural talent for storytelling captivated listeners of all ages.
meanings.sent5: The nurtural way the birds sang in harmony was a delight to the ears.
